title: Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics - University Textbook
subtitle: A Comprehensive Guide to Embodied Intelligence
description: A complete university-level textbook covering Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics with 16 chapters, lab exercises, and AI-native content structure

chapters.title: Introduction to Physical AI
chapters.subtitle: Bridging Artificial Intelligence and Physical Systems
learning_outcomes: Understand the fundamental concepts of Physical AI
Distinguish between traditional AI and Physical AI
Identify key applications of Physical AI in robotics

sections.title: What is Physical AI?
sections.content: Physical AI represents the integration of artificial intelligence algorithms with physical systems. Unlike traditional AI that operates in virtual environments, Physical AI must navigate the complexities of the real world including physics, sensorimotor coordination, and environmental interactions.

diagrams.title: Physical AI Conceptual Framework
diagrams.description: Diagram showing the intersection of AI algorithms, physical systems, and real-world environments

examples.title: ROS 2 Example: Basic Publisher-Subscriber
examples.code:
import rclpy
from rclpy.node import Node
from std_msgs.msg import String

class MinimalPublisher(Node):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__('minimal_publisher')
        self.publisher_ = self.create_publisher(String, 'topic', 10)
        timer_period = 0.5  # seconds
        self.timer = self.create_timer(timer_period, self.timer_callback)

    def timer_callback(self):
        msg = String()
        msg.data = 'Hello World'
        self.publisher_.publish(msg)
        self.get_logger().info('Publishing: %s' % msg.data)

labs.title: Setting up ROS 2 Environment
labs.description: In this lab, students will install and configure ROS 2 for Physical AI applications

assessments.question: What distinguishes Physical AI from traditional AI?
options: Physical AI operates in real physical environments
assessments.correct_answer: Physical AI operates in real physical environments
assessments.explanation: Physical AI must navigate real-world physics, sensorimotor coordination, and environmental interactions.

sections.title: Historical Context and Evolution
sections.content: The field of Physical AI has evolved from early robotics research to modern embodied intelligence systems. Key milestones include the development of sensorimotor learning, advances in control theory, and the integration of deep learning with physical systems.

diagrams.title: Timeline of Physical AI Development
diagrams.description: Historical timeline showing key developments in Physical AI

chapters.title: Sensorimotor Coordination
chapters.subtitle: Perception and Action in Physical Systems

sections.title: Perception-Action Loops
sections.content: Sensorimotor coordination is fundamental to Physical AI. It involves the continuous cycle of perception, decision-making, and action. In humanoid robotics, this loop must operate in real-time to enable stable locomotion, manipulation, and interaction with the environment.

diagrams.title: Sensorimotor Loop Architecture
diagrams.description: Diagram showing perception, decision, and action components in a feedback loop

examples.title: Isaac Sim: Basic Sensor Integration
examples.code:
import omni
from omni.isaac.core import World
from omni.isaac.core.utils.viewports import set_camera_view
from omni.isaac.range_sensor import _range_sensor

# Initialize Isaac Sim world
world = World(stage_units_in_meters=1.0)

# Create a robot with sensors
robot = world.scene.add(
    Robot(prim_path="/World/Robot", name="my_robot")
)

# Access sensor data
range_sensor = _range_sensor.acquire_range_sensor_interface()
point_cloud = range_sensor.get_point_cloud_data(
    prim_path="/World/Robot/lidar"
)

labs.title: Implementing a Simple Sensorimotor Loop
labs.description: Students will create a basic sensorimotor loop using ROS 2 and Gazebo
instructions: Create a ROS 2 package for sensorimotor control
Connect perception and action in a loop
expected_outcomes: Experience with ROS 2 nodes and topics

assessments.question: Explain the importance of real-time processing in sensorimotor coordination for humanoid robots.
assessments.rubric: Response should mention feedback delays, stability, and environmental interaction.

chapters.title: Embodied Cognition
chapters.subtitle: How Body Shape and Physics Influence Intelligence
learning_outcomes: Analyze the role of morphology in intelligence

sections.title: Morphological Computation
sections.content: Embodied cognition emphasizes that intelligence emerges from the interaction between an agent's body, environment, and control system. Morphological computation refers to the idea that the physical properties of a body can simplify computational tasks.

diagrams.title: Embodied Cognition Framework
diagrams.description: Diagram showing interaction between body, environment, and control system

chapters.title: Learning in Physical Systems
chapters.subtitle: Adaptation and Control in Dynamic Environments
learning_outcomes: Implement reinforcement learning for physical systems

sections.title: Reinforcement Learning in Robotics
sections.content: Applying reinforcement learning to physical systems presents unique challenges including safety constraints, sample efficiency, and sim-to-real transfer. This section covers techniques for safe exploration and efficient learning in physical domains.

diagrams.title: RL in Physical Systems Architecture
diagrams.description: Diagram showing RL agent interacting with physical environment

sections.title: Popular Humanoid Platforms
sections.content: This section covers the major humanoid robot platforms including Honda's ASIMO, Boston Dynamics' Atlas, SoftBank's Pepper, and research platforms like the NAO and HRP-4. Each platform offers different capabilities and trade-offs between mobility, manipulation, and computational power.

diagrams.title: Humanoid Robot Platform Comparison
diagrams.description: Comparison chart of major humanoid platforms

examples.title: NAO Robot Control with ROS
examples.code:
# Example code to control NAO robot
from naoqi import ALProxy

# Connect to NAO
motion_proxy = ALProxy("ALMotion", "nao.local", 9559)

# Move the robot
motion_proxy.moveTo(0.5, 0, 0)  # Move forward 0.5m

labs.title: NAO Robot Simulation
labs.description: Students will work with NAO robot simulation in Gazebo

sections.title: Bipedal Walking Dynamics
sections.content: Bipedal locomotion is one of the most challenging aspects of humanoid robotics. This section covers the dynamics of walking, including center of mass control, foot placement, and balance maintenance during gait transitions.

diagrams.title: Bipedal Walking Phase Diagram
diagrams.description: Diagram showing double support, single support, and swing phases

sections.title: Grasping and Dexterous Manipulation
sections.content: Humanoid robots require sophisticated manipulation capabilities to interact with objects in their environment. This section covers grasping strategies, force control, and dexterous manipulation techniques.

diagrams.title: Grasp Types and Contact Points
diagrams.description: Diagram showing different grasp types and contact points

sections.title: Social Robotics Principles
sections.content: Humanoid robots are designed to interact with humans in social contexts. This section covers the principles of social robotics, including non-verbal communication, emotional expression, and social norms.

diagrams.title: Human-Robot Interaction Framework
diagrams.description: Diagram showing communication channels and feedback loops

sections.title: Domain Randomization and Transfer Learning
sections.content: Sim-to-real transfer is crucial for Physical AI, allowing policies learned in simulation to work in the real world. This section covers domain randomization, system identification, and reality gap minimization techniques.

diagrams.title: Sim-to-Real Transfer Pipeline
diagrams.description: Diagram showing simulation, domain randomization, and real-world deployment

chapters.title: Physics-Informed Neural Networks
chapters.subtitle: Integrating Physical Laws with Deep Learning
learning_outcomes: Understand conservation laws in neural networks

sections.title: Physics-Informed Learning
sections.content: Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) incorporate physical laws directly into the learning process. This approach ensures that learned models respect fundamental physical constraints such as conservation of energy and momentum.

diagrams.title: PINN Architecture
diagrams.description: Diagram showing neural network with physics constraint integration

chapters.title: Embodied Learning
chapters.subtitle: Learning Through Physical Interaction
learning_outcomes: Evaluate learning progress in physical systems

sections.title: Curiosity-Driven Learning
sections.content: Embodied learning systems learn through physical interaction with their environment. This section covers curiosity-driven exploration, intrinsic motivation, and self-supervised learning in physical systems.

diagrams.title: Embodied Learning Loop
diagrams.description: Diagram showing exploration, interaction, and learning cycle

sections.title: Cooperative Physical Systems
sections.content: Multiple physical AI agents can coordinate to achieve complex tasks. This section covers communication protocols, distributed control, and emergent behaviors in multi-robot systems.

diagrams.title: Multi-Robot Coordination Network
diagrams.description: Diagram showing communication and coordination between robots

sections.title: Manufacturing Robotics
sections.content: Physical AI is increasingly used in manufacturing for tasks requiring dexterity, adaptability, and human-robot collaboration. This section covers applications in assembly, quality control, and flexible manufacturing.

diagrams.title: Industrial Physical AI Ecosystem
diagrams.description: Diagram showing robots, sensors, and control systems in manufacturing

sections.title: Assistive Robotics
sections.content: Service robots assist humans in daily tasks, from domestic chores to healthcare support. This section covers navigation, manipulation, and human-robot interaction in service applications.

diagrams.title: Service Robot Architecture
diagrams.description: Diagram showing perception, planning, and action components

chapters.title: Safety and Ethics in Physical AI
chapters.subtitle: Responsible Development and Deployment
learning_outcomes: Analyze safety considerations in Physical AI

sections.title: Safety in Physical AI Systems
sections.content: Safety is paramount in Physical AI systems that operate in close proximity to humans. This section covers safety standards, fail-safe mechanisms, and risk assessment in physical AI applications.

diagrams.title: Safety Framework for Physical AI
diagrams.description: Diagram showing safety layers and protocols

chapters.title: Future Directions
chapters.subtitle: Emerging Trends and Research Frontiers
learning_outcomes: Identify emerging trends in Physical AI

sections.title: Research Frontiers
sections.content: The field of Physical AI continues to evolve with new research directions including neuromorphic physical systems, bio-hybrid robots, and quantum-enhanced physical AI. This section explores these emerging areas.

diagrams.title: Physical AI Research Landscape
diagrams.description: Diagram showing current and future research directions

capstone.title: Capstone Project: Autonomous Humanoid Assistant
capstone.description: Students will design and implement an autonomous humanoid robot capable of performing a complex task in a dynamic environment
objectives: Design a complete Physical AI system
Demonstrate system in simulation and/or real hardware

metadata.target_audience: University students with basic robotics knowledge
